reviews.text: Just returned home from an 8 day stay at the Thompson Chicago and everything about our experience was positive. To start, the location couldn't be better. Walking distance to all the best shopping, restaurants and nightlife. The hotel is beautifully appointed, with a hip vibe and and thoughtful design. There were 3 of us traveling, 2 in regular rooms and 1 in a suite. All rooms were spacious with really comfortable beds, fabulous bathrooms, fantastic views and really cool decor. But the BEST thing about the Thompson Chicago is the staff. Everyone exceeded our expectations. The front desk staff was extremely efficient and so pleasant! Working with Cheryl, the concierge was delightful. Very knowledgable and a real sweetheart! And Gary, Verdell, Louis, Sam, Dan and Edwin… what can I say? These guys are stellar!!! Always smiling, so cheerful and eager to help. They made our stay so enjoyable. Even the housekeeping staff (especially the lovely woman who took care of my sons rooms on the 11th floor :) did a great job and were so personable. It was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. We love visiting Chicago and look forward to staying at the Thompson the next time we are in town.
reviews.title: Our New Favorite Place to Stay in Chicago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at Thompson hotels in NYC and DC, and were happy to find that they had opened a new hotel in Chicago. We were just in town for one night, but it was fantastic. The lobby is chic, but welcoming, with a fire warming you up as you enter. The restaurant wasn't opened yet. Check in was a breeze. We had booked through travel-zoo, so were a little nervous that we'd get the smallest room in the house, so we were delighted to open the door to find a spacious corner room on the 11th floor - room 1113. Really beautiful, lovely room. Great decor. Comfortable seating area. Fun art. I loved the bathroom - even though I usually hate rain showers. I will say that the tile flooring was freezing, but it was beautiful, so I won't complain. Super nice bath products. And my favorite touch in a while in any hotel - a night light setting in the bathroom. Comfortable bed with lovely linens! The staff was all incredibly friendly. And if you don't know Chicago very well, trust me, this is a fantastic location. Great spot!
reviews.title: Fantastic new hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Thompson Hotel is a stylish and modern hotel with an excellent staff and service. The vibe is luxurious with a slightly masculine feel thanks to the tweed fabrics and dark woods and tiles. Located in the Gold Coast it makes for an excellent stay in the city close to many restaurants and shopping. Once the restaurant and bar open next month (Dec. 2013) it will be even better.
reviews.title: Luxurious, modern, and masculine

reviews.text: Great service!!!!!!! I love the Thompson Hotel chain so I was excited to try the new hotel in Chicago. Beautiful rooms, bathroom, great size with a Lake Michigan view. Steps from Oak St shopping.We really want to go back when the restaurant is open. The space is absolutely beautiful.
reviews.title: Great Staycation
Wish the weekends were longer...
reviews.text: My husband and I came up to Chicago for the weekend to see the holiday parade and get away for a while. Let me just say, I wish the weekend was longer so we would have more time to spend at the Thompson Hotel!

Great room (we had a corner king suite) with killer views of the city.Perfect location in the Gold Coast ares of Chicago. Lobby and newly opened bar/restaurant were as expected from a thompson property. The gym needs attention - looks like they threw a bunch of equipment into an old conference room on the 4th level. Overall I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit to Chicago.
reviews.title: almost there

reviews.text: I stayed recently (end of Nov.) for my brother's birthday. The staff was top notch & very friendly & helpful. I was told it had just undergone a $50 million renovation & it showed, everywhere. Modern & inviting lobby. Rooms clean & fresh with all new bathroom fixtures. Great tub & shower. We had a room on the 21st floor, corner room w/many huge windows offering city as well as lake views. Great location w/ shopping, restaurants, & bars all within walking distance.What's not to like, give it a try you wont be disappointed.
reviews.title: Worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Opened in September, used to be another hotel. Contemporary rooms but very comfortable. Great beds, colors, and liked wrap around couch in standard room. Huge walk in shower, liked the surface, almost like a rubber so non slip. Very European looking. Staff was very friendly. Restaurant just opened in December, hadn't begun serving breakfast yet. Only complaint was free coffee service advertised, and had run out early on Sat, said would take awhile to replace. On Sunday not even there. Lots of other hotels do not have restaurants open for Breakfast and they manage to keep the coffee flowing. Liked staying North of Water Tower in the Gold Coast area, not so busy, but still many good restaurants in walking distance and of course good shopping. Also liked on website they told you price of valet parking which but they also told you of two other garages where you could self park. Need more hotels to follow suit! Definitely would stay there again.
reviews.title: New Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I are just coming home from an amazing stay at the thompson. Firstly, friendly staff, beautiful lobby and the rooms are so nice and modern, bathroom/shower is very cool as well. The beds can you say comfort city. I have never slept so comfortably in a hotel. Their blanket is a comfortable down and just so clean and cozy. The location is dead in the center of exactly where you want to be. They have an original pancake house across the street a pub kiddie corner and shopping galore. You really don't need a taxi to go anywhere. They have complimentary great tasting coffee from 6-9am and a great gym. They just opened their new restaurant "nico" which we didn't try but it was packed both nights we were there. Definitely coming back the next time I visit Chicago. Manager imran Jivani was very helpful and gave us his card and let us know if we need anything at all to contact him for future stays as well. A plus. Definitely a 5 star
reviews.title: Comfortable amazing experience
Fantastic experience !
reviews.text: Thank you Thompson and Nico restaurant for so far best accomodation and dining experience in Chicago.Simply perfect,will come again definitely!!!We are glad and lucky to stay in such amaizing place.Congratulations to staff and management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed here. Located in a great section of downtown Chicago. Rush street is steps away with all kinds of dining options. Staff was excellent. They asked if we were there for anything special it was our wedding anniversary. Staff sent a couple of Sprinkles gourmet cupcakes to our room. Such a nice gesture. Rooms were very nice. Great view of Lake Michigan and lots of windows. The only downside was that since it was their soft opening. (only opened 10 days) they did not have any glass glasses only plastic. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I were in Chicago for the weekend and this property could not be situated in a better neighborhood! We had the best of shops and restaurants at our doorstep, in an upscale part of town. From the moment we arrived at this beautiful, newly renovated hotel, everything was near perfect. We were charmingly greeted by Gary at the front door (one of our favourite people) who had the best recommendations for us, for nearby spots - he really knows his stuff.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.text: Another stand out for us was Cheryl, the concierge - a wealth of information and everything she recommended lived up to the expectations we had. Overall the politeness and friendliness of the staff made our stay awesome. The room itself was immaculate and modern and near perfect (we were only missing a trash can; which was immediately delivered to us). I wouldn't stay anywhere else for my next visit; especially because of the great value.
reviews.title: With a few minor changes, this will be a great hotel
Nice hotel with some bugs to work out
reviews.text: This is THE place to stay in Chicago. I personally give it 5 stars.

reviews.text: I want to start this review by saying I would give it a 4.5 stars if I could. It is almost a perfect hotel...it is in a great neighbourhood/location (at most, a 5-7 minute walk to the red line..bus stops are everywhere in chicago...and a 5 minute walk to the magnificient mile). The hotel is very clean, post-modern looking/decorations. The price was reasonable for the quality of the hotel, especially if you get it on hotwire/priceline like I did.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brother in Law & Wife, -- Guests of The Thompson Chicago Hotel.
reviews.title: The Thompson is Blossoming

reviews.text: I have to say the Thompson Chicago runs as smooth as a Swiss clock with smiles, kindness and European professionalism. When I arrived it was a freezing 2 degrees and the smiling Doormen got me out of the car into the Lobby in seconds not even feeling the sub-zero conditions. They are some of the best Doorman I have ever met at any hotel – there are always at least 2 or 3 at any time of the day. Amela whom heads the Front Desk really sets the fabulous tone at this new hotel. She is hospitable, generous and extremely professional as she got me a wonderful high room with a spectacular view as requested and all with a smile. Once settled into this very smart, clean and comfortable room (the bed is amazing as the linen), enjoying the great art on the walls and view of Miracle Mile I decided to head back out into the frozen cityscape. Amela pointed me in great directions for restaurants within minutes walking distance and the restaurant did not disappoint. Nico, the new hotel restaurant that just opened is great but booked out that eve. The following night I managed to eat at Nico and the service and drinks was fantastic but be weary of the menu and choose well as it’s quite heavy Italian and the portions are large. The cavernous bar is great for an after work swank drink in a very well designed space. Think “Gstaad Lodge meets Silicon Valley” when you picture the entire designed experience from hotel room to bar. Amela reminds me of those fantastic European Hotels in Vienna where nothing is a problem and all is discrete – such as holding suitcases while you shop; help finding your wallet (thank goodness) and so forth. The neighborhood is winter holiday sublime with the windows of Barneys, Hermes and Brioni all with yards of the hotel. Clearly, the hotel and its staff made a great impression and I will be back the next time I am in this spin chillingly freezing city!!!
reviews.title: Amela made it happen !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Chicago, a little shopping, dining and people watching, but, the BEST place was our hotel! Everyone was so cheery and happy. They were friendly, helpful, available for any kind of help, taxis were fun to request because the outside staff were so jolly and eager. This hotel used to be The Sutton Place (we were married there in 2008) Great location, but the improvements are amazing. Upbeat, friendly, no stuffiness here and everyone is happy. Really happy! We go to Chicago 5-6 times a year and hands down, this is the BEST place to reside for your trip!!! I give Thompson a home town 10. Décor is a 10, Staff is a 10. We were even sent a bottle of champagne, thank you Danny, when she learned of our ceremony 5 years ago. Be on the look out for Amela and Kylie at the front desk. They are wonderful! Gee, I have to go back! I am already missing the Thompson and my home town!
reviews.title: Happiest Time of the Year!
Finally A "Chic" Hotel Done Right
reviews.text: I'm kinda of a design geek, and I loved this hotel. It felt modern and contemporary without being ridiculous or over-the-top. One of a very few hotels I've been in where everything about felt good. The rooms are just the right size and are beautifully laid out. The bathroom is palatial and the European-style shower takes up one half/an entire side of the bathroom, so you don't have to worry about getting everything else in the bathroom soaked while shower. The lighting was interesting, functional and fun. Bed was very comfy too. They did a pretty good job with noise control, and it was overall a very quiet stay. Though our room was near the elevator and we heard noise from that, but it wasn't too bad. We were also supposed to have a "Lakeview" room, so while I'm sure our room was might have been technically facing the lake, there were so many other buildings we couldn't see anything at all.

My only complaint is that I wish the bar area was bigger. We got back to the hotel on the early side on the Saturday night and just wanted a drink and maybe some dessert, but didn't feel like going to the restaurant. The bar was way too packed so we ended up across the street at Luxebar (overpriced for some things in my opinion, but good). Staff is SUPER and in particular the bell staff! They were always extremely pleasant and friendly!
reviews.title: Great stay at the Thompson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't eat at Nico, the restaurant, but it had just opened the Friday we arrived and it was packed the whole weekend, so that is a good sign. It is a bit of a hike to the El (closest station is Chicago on the red line), and while there are a lot of higher-end restaurants in the neighborhood, there isn't much variety. It's also a great neighborhood if you're into shopping and pretty quiet overall as a result.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, beautiful, high end neighborhood!

reviews.text: Mark Roberts was amazing. I needed help getting a surprise to my daughter for her birthday and he gave me a number of suggestions. He is going to pick up cupcakes for me! What a great addition to your staff
reviews.title: Mark Roberts

reviews.text: I stayed at the Thompson on its opening night. The hotel is in a great location and is beautifully appointed. With time, and as another reviewer aptly notes, after working out their kinks, I would expect the hotel to achieve 5-star status. All staff were super friendly and hospitable. Recognizing that this was opening night, here are some suggestions to management: 1) turn down the lobby music (it was at disco levels during the two days we were there; I couldn't imagine how anyone could hear themselves think!); 2) provide instructions on how to use the shower (the faucet design is so modern and complicated, it was difficult to get really hot water -- one time it worked; the second it didn't (brrr!)); 3) you need a "business center" where guests can log on and print out their boarding passes and/or other documents; 4) the fitness room needs fans, towels, disinfectant wipes and bottled water or cups; the TVs were not hooked up but seemed to be hung at locations that would not be seen by anyone using the equipment; 5) rooms need luggage racks and a convenient outlet box to hook up one's laptop, phone chargers, etc. (for a brand new hotel, I was surprised by the lack of convenient outlets); and install phones near the elevators on each floor (so guests can call the front desk especially when they're having problems with their room key (like I did). Again, I think this will be a great hotel if and when these issues can be resolved and especially once the restaurant opens.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but work in progress

reviews.text: I stayed at the Thompson Chicago with my wife this past weekend. Overall, I would say that the hotel is very nice, and the location is great. However, being that they just opened, they still have some kinks to work out.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but still has to work out the kinks
